message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DB, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with name matching, which is a common problem in information retrieval (IR) and record linkage. The authors use machine learning techniques to learn alternative spellings of names, which is a natural language processing (NLP) task falling under the category of computational linguistics (CL). The use of a large collection of genealogy person records and user search query logs suggests that the paper may also be relevant to databases (DB) and artificial intelligence (AI) research. Finally, the authors compare their method with standard phonetic and string similarity methods, which is a common practice in machine learning (ML) and statistical learning (LG).
